did.unittitle: Franklin O. Bunting vs. The State of Oregon Brief for Defendant in Error, 1915
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Two volumes of the Brief for Defendant in Error, in Franklin O. Bunting vs. The State of Oregon, in a case before the Supreme Court of the United States.

bioghist.p: From the brief: "Statement of Case. The plaintiff in error was convicted in the district court of Lake County, Oregon, for violation of a statute colloquially known as "the Ten Hour Law," (Oregon Laws of 1913, Chap. 102). The conviction was affirmed by the Supreme Court of Oregon (Opinion, R.12; 71 Or. 259). In affirming the conviction of the Oregon Supreme Court sustained the constitutionality of the statute agains the claim of the defendant that it offended the Fourteenth Amendment. This claim is the foundation of the present writ of error."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two volumes of the Brief for Defendant in Error, in Franklin O. Bunting vs. The State of Oregon, in a case before the Supreme Court of the United States.

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: Franklin O. Bunting vs. The State of Oregon Brief for Defendant in Error #5356. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
